fields.description:
I can launch instances but can't log... 
ssh command show:
OpenSSH_6.2p2 Ubuntu-6ubuntu0.4, OpenSSL 1.0.1e 11 Feb 2013
debug1: Reading configuration data /home/arturo/.ssh/config
debug1: /home/arturo/.ssh/config line 1: Applying options for *
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: /etc/ssh/ssh_config line 19: Applying options for *
debug1: Connecting to 10.0.1.225 [10.0.1.225] port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file euca-redd.pem type -1
debug1: identity file euca-redd.pem-cert type -1
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_6.2p2 Ubuntu-6ubuntu0.4
debug1: Remote protocol version 2.0, remote software version OpenSSH_6.2p2 Ubuntu-6ubuntu0.3
debug1: match: OpenSSH_6.2p2 Ubuntu-6ubuntu0.3 pat OpenSSH*
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT sent
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT received
debug1: kex: server->client aes128-ctr hmac-md5-etm@openssh.com none
debug1: kex: client->server aes128-ctr hmac-md5-etm@openssh.com none
debug1: sending SSH2_MSG_KEX_ECDH_INIT
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_ECDH_REPLY
debug1: Server host key: ECDSA 45:b0:61:b2:20:d0:b9:c8:b0:0c:78:72:3e:00:7e:99
debug1: Host '10.0.1.225' is known and matches the ECDSA host key.
debug1: Found key in /home/arturo/.ssh/known_hosts:31
debug1: ssh_ecdsa_verify: signature correct
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS received
debug1: Roaming not allowed by server
debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST sent
debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_ACCEPT received
debug1: Authentications that can continue: publickey
debug1: Next authentication method: publickey
debug1: Offering RSA public key: arturo@ursus
debug1: Authentications that can continue: publickey
debug1: Trying private key: euca-redd.pem
debug1: read PEM private key done: type RSA
debug1: Authentications that can continue: publickey
debug1: No more authentication methods to try.
Permission denied (publickey).

I try this with different images/distributions and get the same errors...
fields.summary: unable to log to instances - ssh Roaming not allowed by server

comments.body:
[~turoart]

We need more info in order to proceed with this issue.

Can you please provide:
- eucalyptus.conf from all machines
- Topology of all machines
- Output from euca-describe-services
- Method of installation
- 'iptables -L -t nat' on all machines
- 'iptables -L' on all machines
- 'ip addr show' on all machines
- Output from 'euca-describe-instances' and 'euca-describe-groups'
- Console output from the instance in question

Thanks [~viglesias] 

Here is the info request...
eucalyptus.conf is the attach file

h4. Topology
only one server running cloud, cluster, node...

h4. euca-describe-services
{quote}
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Jetty   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	10.0.0.150     	NOTREADY  	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:eucalyptus:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Dns     	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	autoscaling    	autoscaling    	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:eucalyptus:autoscaling:autoscaling:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	cluster        	cluster01      	cc-node1       	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc-node1/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	tokens         	eucalyptus     	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Tokens  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	cloudwatch     	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloudwatch:cloudwatch:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	euare          	eucalyptus     	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Euare   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.0.0.150     	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.0.0.150/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	walrus-node1   	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Walrus  	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus-node1/
SERVICE	storage        	cluster01      	sc-node1       	ENABLED   	31  	http://10.0.0.150:8773/services/Storage 	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:storage:sc-node1/
{quote}

h4. Method of installation
I get the code from github and follow some guides, mostly this [guide|http://alinush.org/2013/07/21/how-to-compile-and-install-eucalyptus-3-3-0-on-ubuntu-13-04-from-github-sources-cloud-in-a-box/]

h4. 'iptables -L -t nat'
{quote}
Chain PREROUTING (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         

Chain INPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         

Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         

Chain POSTROUTING (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
MASQUERADE  tcp  --  192.168.122.0/24    !192.168.122.0/24     masq ports: 1024-65535
MASQUERADE  udp  --  192.168.122.0/24    !192.168.122.0/24     masq ports: 1024-65535
MASQUERADE  all  --  192.168.122.0/24    !192.168.122.0/24
{quote}

h4. 'iptables -L'
{quote}
Chain INPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
ACCEPT     udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp dpt:domain
ACCEPT     tcp  --  anywhere             anywhere             tcp dpt:domain
ACCEPT     udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp dpt:bootps
ACCEPT     tcp  --  anywhere             anywhere             tcp dpt:bootps

Chain FORWARD (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
ACCEPT     all  --  anywhere             192.168.122.0/24     state RELATED,ESTABLISHED
ACCEPT     all  --  192.168.122.0/24     anywhere            
ACCEPT     all  --  anywhere             anywhere            
REJECT     all  --  anywhere             anywhere             reject-with icmp-port-unreachable
REJECT     all  --  anywhere             anywhere             reject-with icmp-port-unreachable
LOG        udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp spts:bootps:bootpc dpts:bootps:bootpc LOG level info

Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination 
{quote}

h4. 'ip addr show'
{quote}
1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 65536 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN 
    link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00
    inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
    inet6 ::1/128 scope host 
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
2: eth0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq master br0 state UP qlen 1000
    link/ether 9c:8e:99:58:f2:34 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
3: eth1: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST> mtu 1500 qdisc noop state DOWN qlen 1000
    link/ether 9c:8e:99:58:f2:35 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
4: eth2: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST> mtu 1500 qdisc noop state DOWN qlen 1000
    link/ether 9c:8e:99:58:f2:36 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
5: eth3: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST> mtu 1500 qdisc noop state DOWN qlen 1000
    link/ether 9c:8e:99:58:f2:37 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
7: virbr0: <NO-CARRIER,BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP> mtu 1500 qdisc noqueue state DOWN 
    link/ether 3e:db:8f:91:a7:70 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 192.168.122.1/24 brd 192.168.122.255 scope global virbr0
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
14: br0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc noqueue state UP 
    link/ether 9c:8e:99:58:f2:34 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 10.0.0.150/16 brd 10.0.255.255 scope global br0
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
    inet6 fe80::9e8e:99ff:fe58:f234/64 scope link 
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
18: vnet0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc pfifo_fast master br0 state UNKNOWN qlen 500
    link/ether fe:0d:88:2e:43:c4 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet6 fe80::fc0d:88ff:fe2e:43c4/64 scope link 
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
{quote}

h4. Output from 'euca-describe-instances' and 'euca-describe-groups'
euca-describe-instances show nothing
euca-describe-groups:
{quote}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/euca-describe-groups", line 5, in <module>
    pkg_resources.run_script('euca2ools==3.0.2-17-g0c146d8', 'euca-describe-groups')
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 499, in run_script
    self.require(requires)[0].run_script(script_name, ns)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 1235, in run_script
    execfile(script_filename, namespace, namespace)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/euca2ools-3.0.2_17_g0c146d8-py2.7.egg/EGG-INFO/scripts/euca-describe-groups", line 3, in <module>
    import euca2ools.commands.ec2.describesecuritygroups
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/euca2ools-3.0.2_17_g0c146d8-py2.7.egg/euca2ools/commands/ec2/__init__.py", line 42, in <module>
    from euca2ools.util import substitute_euca_region
ImportError: cannot import name substitute_euca_region
{quote}

h4. Console output from the instance in question
[^instance_console_output.txt]

Thanks for the help!

[~turoart]

The issue is that in SYSTEM mode the metadata service is not available. This is by design. As a result of metadata not being available the instance cannot get its ssh key to allow access.

Thank you very much [~viglesias]

Is there a workaround for this? What's your recommendation? do I have to use other mode instead of system?

apologize if I overwhelmed you with so many question, but, what is the right place to make 'how to' questions for eucalyptus (use, configuration, installation, better practices...)?

[~turoart]

No worries at all.  I would definitely recommend switching to one of the MANAGED modes.

The best place to get community help is in IRC:
http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=eucalyptus

Join us there for more info.
